thread.title: Advanced Battery Concepts announces the addition of James Symanski to their Technology Advisory Board

author: cnbc.com
title: Advanced Battery Concepts announces the addition of James Symanski to their Technology Advisory Board
text:
CLARE, Mich., March 6, 2018 /PRNewswire/ -- Advanced Battery Concepts is pleased to announce that Dr. James Symanski has joined its Technology Advisory Board (TAB). Dr. Symanski recently retired from Johnson Controls after a prestigious and successful career. Having started with JCI in 1984 as a Senior Scientist, Dr. Symanski retired at the end of 2017 as the Director of Advanced Product Engineering. He worked on projects that included nickel-hydrogen battery design, lithium-ion polymer battery development, and other non-lead technologies, including ultracapacitors. Dr. Symanski also led the JCI team in the Li-Ion battery joint venture with Saft-Bordeaux and eventually helped work on various micro-hybrid applications. Having nine patents and many publications, Dr. Symanski brings a wealth of knowledge to the ABC Technology Development Board.
"I am pleased that Dr. Symanski has joined our team. His experience and knowledge in the industry and advancements in not only lead technology but other chemistries will be a great asset to our team," said Bob Galyen, Chairman of ABC's Technology Board.
Dr. Edward Shaffer, CEO of Advanced Battery Concepts commented "Dr. Symanski is well respected in the lead industry and we are very excited for him to join our team." Dr. Shaffer emphasized "GreenSeal® Technology is revolutionizing the lead industry with four major manufacturers licensed and many more coming. Jim's experience and leadership will help ABC not only strengthen its lead battery technology but will provide tremendous insight into other high-growth technology areas. We look forward to Jim's contributions to our TAB and helping ABC fulfill its mission – Better Batteries, Better World©"
About Advanced Battery Concepts, LLC
Advanced Battery Concepts LLC is a global battery technology development company based in Michigan, USA, and is the first company to successfully design and implement a commercially viable manufacturing process for advanced, bipolar lead batteries. Advanced Battery Concepts is working with existing lead battery producers through license to realize the commercial potential of this game-changing technology as well as broaden its technology portfolio with on-going product & process research at its Battery Engineering & Manufacturing Development Center in Michigan.
For more information, visit www.advancedbatteryconcepts.com
